dcterms:description: The PEN task involves jumping from one word to the next according to a matching criterion, outputting all neighbors along the way. It tests the model's ability to infer from neighbors rather than directly copying previous words.
dcterms:title: Pointer Executionâ€™s Neighbour (PEN)

dcterms:description: The PER Multi task requires the model to first output the last word in a matching sequence and then go backward, counting the number of matchings and left matchings, ultimately multiplying these counts.
dcterms:title: Pointer Execution Reverse Multicount (PER Multi)

dcterms:description: C-PVR is a dataset that serves as a basis for the PEN task, focusing on the retrieval of values based on pointers.
dcterms:title: C-PVR

dcterms:description: The PVR dataset focuses on the retrieval of values based on pointers, serving as a foundational dataset for understanding pointer-based tasks.
dcterms:title: Pointer Value Retrieval (PVR)
